impact-statement: Central thalamus relay neurons dynamically switch the activity of cortical and subcortical networks at distinct frequencies, providing a mechanism for this region's role in arousal regulation.

equal-contrib.equal-contrib: These authors contributed equally to this work

contribution.con1: JL, Collected the fMRI data, Acquisition of data
contribution.con2: HJL, Performed EEG, in vivo single-unit, and field potential electrophysiology recordings
contribution.con3: AJW, Analyzed the fMRI and electrophysiology data and wrote the paper
contribution.con4: ZF, Analyzed the data and helped make figures and videos
contribution.con8: VP, Conducted optical brain slice imaging
contribution.con9: AT, Conducted optical brain slice imaging
contribution.con12: JHL, Designed and planned all experiments, supervised and organized the study, analyzed and interpreted data, wrote the paper, and outlined the figures and videos
contribution.con10: PM, Advised VP and AT, and helped design the experiments
contribution.con11: NS, Helped with the design of the experiments, interpretation of the data, and writing of the paper
